alert.note: Alert for Coastal Collier County; Inland Collier County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 1:46PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Collier County through 230 PM EDT... At 143 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms near Copeland and north of Everglades City. These storms are nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Everglades City, Carnestown, Copeland, Big Cypress National Preserve, Miles City, Fakahatchee Strand State Preserve, Jerome, Deep Lake and Port Of The Island. LIGHTNING...EXCESSIVE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Collier County; Inland Collier County; Mainland Monroe
